scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 201170410 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 201170410 is a star with 0.29 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.28 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

EPIC 201170410 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 201170410 system


EPIC 201170410 b

EPIC 201170410 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2020-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 201170410 b is 1.145 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 201170410 b is 1.047 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, EPIC 201170410 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system EPIC 201170410, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: EPIC 201170410 - System With 1 Exoplanet
